short_summary: Request for Proposal for the supply, delivery and offloading of Miscellaneous Groceries on an as and when required basis for 17 Wing Winnipeg
description: Trade Agreement: Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA)\\(n\)Tendering Procedures: All interested suppliers may submit a bid\\(n\)Competitive Procurement Strategy: Lowest/Lower Bid\\(n\)Comprehensive Land Claim Agreement: No\\(n\)Nature of Requirements: \\(n\)Public Works and Government Services Canada (PWGSC), Western Region, on behalf of Department of National Defence (DND), has a requirement for Regional Individual Standing Offers (RISO's) for the supply, delivery and offloading of Miscellaneous Groceries on an as and when required basis to 17 Wing Winnipeg, located in Winnipeg, Manitoba, for the period of the Standing Offer \\(n\)
full_summary:
## Miscellaneous Groceries 17 Wing Winnipeg

### Solicitation Details

* Solicitation Number: W0117-220007/A
* Contracting Authority: Public Works and Government Services Canada (PWGSC), Western Region
* Department: Department of National Defence (DND)
* Description: Trade Agreement: Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA)
The PWGSC Western Region has a requirement for the supply, delivery, and offloading of Miscellaneous Groceries to 17 Wing Winnipeg, located in Winnipeg, Manitoba. 

### Periods of the Standing Offers

* Approximately four six-month periods:
	1. December 1, 2022 to May 31, 2023
	2. June 1, 2023 to November 30, 2023
	3. December 1, 2023 to May 31, 2024
	4. June 1, 2024 to November 30, 2024

### Bid Information

* Bidder must access the Government Electronic Tendering Service (GETS) for updates on amendments and modifications.
* Bidder must review Annex B for any changes to the rebid-refresh schedule.
* Bidders may submit offers electronically using Canada Post Corporation’s (CPC) Connect service.
* Faxed bids will be accepted, but it is recommended to submit electronically or via the CPC Connect service.
* Submission in either official language of Canada (English or French) will be accepted. 
* Important note: Considering the delays caused by COVID-19, Canada Post recommends electronic submissions. Health and safety remain a priority.

### Evaluation

* Neutral evaluation will be completed as an open and competitive process.
* The offer with the lowest bid will be selected as the successful offeror.

### Purchasing Terms

* The contractor will be required to perform services and provide goods on an “as and when requested” basis. 
* Offerors may submit an offer for one, two, three, four, or all five commodities.
* The contractor will be required to adapt to any changes made to the requirement.

### Regional Master Standing Offer

* A Regional Master Standing Offer (RMSO) for any of the commodities may replace the ‘Standing Offers issued from this solicitation. If an RMSO is issued for a commodity, the Standing Offer will be set aside.

### Submission Information

* All bids must be submitted electronically, via the internet.
* Electronic bids must be transmitted to the following email address: roreceptionSoumissions.wrbidreceiving
